scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries
ministry: Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY): Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries. This initiative is a part of the broader PMMSY, which seeks to bring about ecologically healthy, economically viable, and socially inclusive development of the fisheries sector in India, boosting fish production and farmer incomes.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: The project cost for one unit is ₹25,00,000/-.
The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category (i.e., up to ₹10,00,000/-).
The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women beneficiaries (i.e., up to ₹15,00,000/-).
Encourages the development of modern and efficient freshwater finfish hatcheries.
Facilitates increased production of quality fish seed, which is crucial for expanding aquaculture.
Contributes to self-employment and income generation in the fisheries sector.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) (This is specifically mentioned in some state-level applications, but the core PMMSY guidelines are broader and include individual beneficiaries like fishers, fish farmers, entrepreneurs, and groups like SHGs, JLGs, cooperatives, and private firms).
The freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit or 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.
The hatchery should have a minimum area of 0.50 hectares.
The fish hatchery should be managed by qualified technical staff.
The applicant will ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.
The fish hatchery will include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.
The cost of accreditation of the hatchery must be mandatorily included in the project estimates.

The projects having land on long-term registered lease will also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme. The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.
The applicant, having their own land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.

Beneficiaries who have already availed subsidy for similar projects for pisciculture development under different schemes of Government of India or State Government may not be eligible for the same component again.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online / Offline (submission to District Fisheries Officer)
list_items: Step 1: Beneficiaries are required to submit their Self-Contained Proposal/Detailed Project Report (DPR) in accordance with the operational guidelines of the PMMSY.

Step 2: The DPR/SCP should be submitted to the District Fisheries Officer of their domicile district or the District of the respective States/Union Territories where they intend to undertake the project.

Step 3: For online application, some states may utilize portals like Antyodaya-SARAL Portal. In such cases, the process generally involves: visiting the official portal, registering as a new user or signing in, navigating to the 'Scheme/Services list', selecting the PMMSY scheme component for 'Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries', filling in the online application form with all details, uploading required documents, and submitting the application.

Step 4: After receipt of the DPR/SCP, a Field Verification Committee (e.g., comprising Zonal DDF, District Fisheries Officer, and AFO) shall visit the site to ascertain feasibility and suitability, and submit a report with detailed photo documentation (geo-tagged photos are often required at different stages).
Step 5: All applications with the DPR/SCP and the Field Verification Committee report shall be scrutinized by the State Level Technical Committee (SLTC). The SLTC will approve eligible applications.

Step 6: The District Fisheries Officers must ensure that beneficiaries directly purchase items for installation from genuine firms with GSTIN numbers. Only GST bills are typically accepted for subsidy release. Subsidy is generally released after project completion and verification.

sections.title: Grievance Redressal
sections.content: Any dissatisfaction or complaint regarding the scheme or its implementation can be directed to the respective District Fisheries Officer or the State Fisheries Department. General grievances related to Government of India schemes can often be lodged on centralized grievance portals or helplines provided by the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying or relevant state departments.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Detailed Project Report (DPR)/Self Contained Proposal (SCP) as per Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) guidelines.
Agreement Deed between the beneficiary and the Fisheries Department.
Date Of Birth Certificate (Voting Card/Birth Certificate/Aadhar Card/Matriculation Certificate).
Caste Certificate (from first-class Magistrate/Tehsildar, if applicable for SC category).
Training Certificate of the beneficiary (in fisheries or aquaculture).
Land Record from Tehsil (Own Land - Jamabandi, Nakal Akshizra, Farad) or Registered Lease Deed of minimum 10 years (for leased land).
Bills/Receipts/Vouchers (original GST bills for purchased equipment and construction materials).
Photographs of the hatchery with the beneficiary (geo-tagged photos at various stages: before, during, and after construction).
Details of Bank Account and Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card.
Aadhaar Card (for identity proof).
Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) (if applicable, as per state-specific requirements).
Business Registration Certificate (if applying as a firm/company).
Partnership Deed or Memorandum of Association (MOA) (if applicable).
NOC from the landowner (if applicable, in case of leased land or land not solely owned by the applicant).

scheme_name: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on Annual Auction of Notified Waters
ministry: Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The “Subsidy on Annual Auction of Notified Waters” is a scheme component under the broader Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in the Fisheries Sector, launched by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The primary objective of this scheme is to provide full-time employment opportunities to individuals from Scheduled Caste (SC) families in the fisheries sector and to uplift their socio-economic status. This is achieved by promoting fish farming through the subsidization of fishing contract costs in designated (notified) water bodies. Specifically, the scheme provides a subsidy to eligible Scheduled Caste beneficiaries to help them acquire fishing rights in such notified waters through annual auctions.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Financial Assistance: A 50% subsidy on the actual auctioned amount of notified water bodies, with a maximum limit of ₹5,00,000/- per auction, whichever is less.
Employment Generation: Provides full-time employment opportunities in the fisheries sector for Scheduled Caste families.
Socio-Economic Upliftment: Helps in improving the economic condition and social status of eligible Scheduled Caste beneficiaries by enabling them to engage in profitable fish farming.
Access to Fishing Rights: Reduces the financial barrier for SC individuals to acquire fishing rights in government-controlled water bodies.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The applicant should possess a valid Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).
The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste (SC) category.
The applicant's age should be 18 years or above.
The applicant must not be a Government/Semi-Government employee.

sections.title: Application Process
list_items: **Online Registration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:**
Step 1: Visit the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal (https://saralharyana.gov.in/).
Step 2: For new registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details, including Name, Email ID, Mobile Number, and password. Click on ‘Submit’.
Step 3: Verify the OTP received in the provided Email and Mobile Number. Alternatively, click on the Verification Link to activate the profile.
**Login to Apply for the Scheme:**
Step 1: Visit the Official Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
Step 2: The “Sign in here” option is available on the right side of the screen. Fill in the required credentials (User ID and password) and click on the ‘Login’ button.
Step 3: In the opened window, click on “Scheme/Services list” to view the available schemes.
Step 4: Select the “Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on Annual Auction of Notified Waters” and click on “Apply for Service/Scheme”.
Step 5: Fill in all the details in the online application form accurately and upload all required documents. Click on 'Submit' once done.
**Track Your Service Online:**
Applicants can track their application/appeal status by clicking on the 'Track Application/Appeal' link on the portal.
Applicants can track their ticket status by clicking on the 'Track Ticket' link.
**Track Your Service Through SMS:**
For Registered Mobile Number: Type SARAL and send to 9954699899 to track your application.
For Other Mobile Number: Type SARAL<space><Application ID/Ticket No.> and send to 9954699899 to track your application/ticket.
**Contact Information:**
Email: saral.haryana@gov.in
**Fees For Service:**
Government Charges: ₹0 (No Fee)
Service Charges: ₹10
Atal Seva Kendra Charges: ₹10
**Offline Application:**
Eligible applicants may visit the nearest Atal Seva Kendra with all the required documents to apply for the scheme. The staff at the Kendra will assist with the application process.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Agreement 1 – Registered agreement between the Contractor/Licensee and the Fisheries Department (proof of successfully winning the auction for notified waters).
Date of Birth Certificate (e.g., Birth Certificate, Matriculation Certificate, PAN Card, Voter Card, Driving License).
Identity Proof (e.g., Ration Card, Aadhaar Card, PAN Card, Voter Card).
Caste Certificate (issued by 1st Class Magistrate or competent authority, confirming Scheduled Caste category).
Training Certificate (for Fisheries Training from any Government Institute).
Payment Receipts (proof of payment of the auctioned amount, for which subsidy is sought).
Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra) (Mandatory for Haryana residents).
Bank Passbook (for direct transfer of subsidy).

scheme_name: Pashu Palan Yojana (GSKVN)
ministry: Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam (GSKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme 'Pashu Palan Yojana' is implemented by the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam (GSKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the form of loans to sanitation workers and their dependents. The primary objective is to promote self-employment opportunities through animal husbandry and related activities, thereby enabling this community to achieve economic independence and improve their socio-economic status. This initiative helps in integrating sanitation workers into mainstream economic activities beyond their traditional occupations.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Loan up to ₹1,00,000/- is provided at a subsidized interest rate of 6% to sanitation workers or their dependents for initiating animal husbandry as a business or occupation.
Facilitates self-employment and entrepreneurship within the sanitation worker community.
Provides an alternative and sustainable source of livelihood.
Aims at the holistic socio-economic upliftment of sanitation workers and their families.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant should be a native of Gujarat (permanent resident).
The applicant should be a sanitation worker or a dependent of a sanitation worker.
The age of the applicant (sanitation worker or dependent) should be between 18 and 50 years as on the date of application.

Only applicants who have not previously availed any loan under any scheme of this Corporation (GSKVN) or the Government, including their family members, are eligible to apply under this scheme. This 'one-time' benefit ensures wider reach.
Priority will be given to applicants who are BPL (Below Poverty Line), widowed, abandoned, or persons with disabilities.
The applicant should genuinely intend to start a self-employment venture in animal husbandry or related activities.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online
list_items: **Registration Process on eSamajKalyan Portal:**
Step 1: Visit the Social Justice & Empowerment Department website: https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in.
Step 2: On the homepage, click on “Please Register Here” to begin the registration process.
Step 3: Fill in your personal details exactly as per your Aadhaar Card. Ensure all details are accurate.
Step 4: Create a strong password for your account and submit the registration form.
Step 5: Verify the entered details carefully and click “Confirm”.
Step 6: You will receive your User ID and Password via SMS/email to your registered mobile number/email address.
**Login Process:**
Step 1: Go to the eSamajKalyan portal homepage (https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in).
Step 2: Enter your User ID, Password, and the Captcha code displayed on the screen.
Step 3: Click “Login” to access your personal dashboard.
**Application Process:**
After the initial login, if it's your first time, you will need to complete your User Profile with additional details.
Step 1: The homepage will display various eligible schemes. Click on the 'Pashu Palan Yojana' or the relevant scheme you wish to apply for.
Step 2: Fill out the detailed scheme application form, providing all requested information about your proposed animal husbandry venture.
Step 3: Upload the required documents as specified in the scheme guidelines. Ensure documents are clear and in the prescribed format/size.
Step 4: Review all entered details thoroughly for accuracy. Read and agree to the terms and conditions.
Step 5: Click “Save Application”. You will receive an Application Number.
Step 6: Note down your Application Number for future tracking and reference.
**Track Application:**
Step 1: On the portal, click on “View Application Status”.
Step 2: Enter your Application Number and Date of Birth.
Step 3: Click “View Status” to check the progress of your application.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Applicant's Aadhaar Card (mandatory for identity and residency proof).
Ration card of the applicant (for family details and BPL status if applicable).
Election Identity Card (Voter ID) (for identity and address proof).
Proof of applicant's total annual income (Income Certificate from a competent authority).
Certificate of sanitation worker/dependent (issued by a recognized authority, confirming their status).
Proof of residence (e.g., Electricity bill, Driving License, Rent agreement, Electoral card, Ration card).
BPL Certificate (if the applicant belongs to the Below Poverty Line category, for priority consideration).
Copy of the first page of the bank passbook / cancelled cheque (in the name of the applicant, for direct loan disbursement).
A letter of undertaking stating that the applicant (and family members) has not previously availed any loan or benefits under any scheme of GSKVN or the Government (as per eligibility criteria).
Proof of age (if not evident from Aadhaar/Voter ID, e.g., Birth Certificate, School Leaving Certificate).

scheme_name: Assistance for Planting Vegetable Crops for Raw and Ripe Mandap
ministry: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Government of Gujarat

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Assistance for Planting Vegetable Crops for Raw and Ripe Mandap" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to offer financial support to farmers across Gujarat for constructing various types of vegetable trellises (mandaps). These mandaps are designed using wooden/bamboo supports and GI/plastic wires to facilitate the vertical growth of vegetable crops. The scheme promotes efficient space utilization, improved yield, easier harvesting, and better crop quality by keeping vegetables off the ground. It is particularly beneficial for cultivating vine vegetables, tomatoes, and chilies.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Raw Mandap (for crops like Tomato/Chilli and other non-vine vegetables needing support):**
General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹26,000/hectare.
SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹39,000/hectare.
**Semi-ripe Mandap (for vine vegetables that grow partially on trellis):**
General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹40,000/hectare.
SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹60,000/hectare.
**Ripe Mandap (for heavily vining vegetables needing full trellis support):**
General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹80,000/hectare.
SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹1,20,000/hectare.
**Other Support Details:**
Maximum area eligible: 2 hectares per farmer (per account on i-Khedut portal).
Construction material: The scheme supports the use of 1600 wooden/bamboo poles per hectare and 400 kg of GI wire (12-18 gauge) or plastic wire.
Recommended spacing: A spacing of 2.50 x 2.50 meters is recommended for setting up the mandap structure.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant must be a farmer.
The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
The farmer must own agricultural land or have cultivation rights, as evidenced by a 7/12 certificate.
The scheme is open to farmers from all caste categories (General, SC, ST), with varying subsidy rates.
There is no specified income limit for eligibility under this scheme.
The farmer must plan to construct a mandap as per the scheme's specifications for cultivating eligible vegetable crops.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online
list_items: Step 1: The applicant must visit and apply online at the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/.
Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then navigate to ‘Agricultural Schemes’.

Step 3: Now, select the scheme "Assistance for Planting Vegetable Crops for Raw and Ripe Mandap" (or a similar name related to mandap/trellis construction). Click on the ‘Apply’ button, which will open the application page. New users may need to register and sign in.
Step 4: If applying for the first time, click on the "Apply New" button and proceed to fill out a new application form, providing all required personal, land, and project details.
Step 5: If there are any corrections or updates required for a previously saved application, click on the "Update Application" button.
Step 6: Once the application is completely filled and reviewed for accuracy, confirm it. Only confirmed applications will be processed.
Step 7: Take a printout of the confirmed application for your records.

Step 8: Applicants can also check their Application Status, View, or Print/Upload Application details from the 'Applicant Corner' section available at: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx.
Note: Post-application, field verification may be conducted by agriculture department officials to assess the proposed site and construction.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: 7/12 Certificate (proof of land ownership or cultivation rights).
Aadhaar Card (for identity and residency proof).
Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque (for direct benefit transfer of subsidy).
Caste Certificate (if applicable, for SC/ST farmers to avail higher subsidy).
Proof of residence (e.g., Domicile Certificate, if not clearly established by Aadhaar).
Recent passport-size photograph of the applicant.
Any other document if specifically requested during the online application process or by the verifying authority (e.g., project plan/drawing, estimate of materials).

scheme_name: Agricultural Income Tax Holiday under the Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme
ministry: Finance (Institutional Finance) Department, Government of Assam

sections.title: Details
sections.content: Launched in 2020, the "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme (ATISIS)" by the Finance (Institutional Finance) Department, Government of Assam, aims to ensure the long-term financial sustainability of the Tea industry and to incentivize manufacturers to move from Crush, Tear, Curl (CTC) tea to Orthodox and Specialty tea production. The scheme is implemented by the Finance Department and the Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Assam, through multiple implementing agencies, including banks and the District Industries & Commerce Centre. The applications for this scheme are accepted online through a dedicated portal with a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mechanism for reimbursement.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Benefit Period: 3 years of Agricultural Income Tax holiday.

Applicable Financial Years: The tax holiday is applicable for the financial years 2022-23 to 2024-25. (Note: Initial launch in 2020 covered FY 2019-20 to 2021-22, and it has been extended for the specified period).
Condition: To avail the benefit, Agricultural Income Tax returns must be filed within the due date; if not filed on the due date, interest and penalty will be applicable.
Financial Relief: Provides significant financial relief to tea estates by exempting them from agricultural income tax for the specified period, improving their liquidity and profitability.
Promotes Orthodox and Specialty Tea Production: By reducing the tax burden, the scheme indirectly encourages investment and transition towards higher-value tea production methods.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant must be a tea plantation across all sizes.
The applicant must be a tea manufacturing unit manufacturing Crush, Tear, Curl Tea, Orthodox Tea, or Speciality tea (including Green tea, Oolong Tea, White tea, Yellow tea, and Purple tea).
The applicant's tea plantation and/or manufacturing unit must be located entirely in Assam.
The applicant must not have any part of the plantation or manufacturing facility located outside the State of Assam.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online
list_items: **Registration Process on the Dedicated Portal:**
Step 1: Visit the dedicated online portal of the "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives" Scheme.

Step 2: Click on the "New User Registration" option. In the registration form, fill in basic details including name, mobile number, and email address. Create a username and password following the portal's password policy. Verify your mobile number through a one-time password (OTP) verification. Complete Captcha Code verification. Submit the registration form.
Step 3: Check your registered email for the account activation link. Click on the activation link to activate the account. Log in to the portal using your newly registered credentials.

Step 4: Upload all supporting documents of eligibility in the prescribed format. Fill in complete unit details, including location, type of tea production, and capacity. Submit the unit registration form. Wait for registration approval from the authorities.
**Application Process for Benefits:**
Step 1: Log in to the portal using your registered credentials. Navigate to the "Apply for Benefits" section.
Step 2: Select the specific scheme component that you intend to apply for (in this case, 'Agricultural Income Tax Holiday'). Fill in the prescribed application form with all mandatory fields.

Step 3: Upload all supporting documents as mentioned in the portal. Ensure file formats and file size restrictions are followed as per the portal guidelines. Ensure all documents are clear and legible. Complete the document verification checklist.
Step 4: Review the complete application carefully before final submission. Apply online.

**Important Note:** Applicants are strongly encouraged to note down the application reference number and save a copy of the submitted application form and confirmation message for future reference and tracking purposes.
**Application Status Tracking:**
Log in to the portal to check the application status.
Track application progress through different stages of verification (e.g., submitted, under scrutiny, approved, disbursed).
Receive Short Message Service (SMS) alerts throughout the process, including registration, fund release, etc.
For Technical Support, please write to atisis.assam@gmail.com.
**Disbursement Process:**
The Finance Department releases the benefit (tax holiday/reimbursement) directly to the beneficiary's registered bank account.
SMS alerts are sent for funds disbursement, informing the beneficiary about the direct benefit transfer.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Agricultural Income Tax Return Filing Documents (for the relevant financial years to confirm compliance).
Tea Estate Registration Certificate (proof of establishment and registration as a tea garden).
Aadhaar Card (for identity verification of the applicant/authorized signatory).
Permanent Account Number (PAN) Card (of the entity/proprietor).
Business Registration Certificate (e.g., Company Registration, Partnership Deed, Proprietorship registration).
Bank Account Details (Bank Passbook copy or cancelled cheque for DBT).
Address Proof of Unit Location in Assam (e.g., Land ownership documents, lease agreements, utility bills for the tea estate/factory in Assam).
Proof of Production Type (e.g., records indicating manufacturing of CTC, Orthodox, or Specialty tea).
Any other documents specifically requested on the ATISIS portal during the application process.

scheme_name: Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole
ministry: Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The "Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole" launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, is designed to preserve and promote indigenous breeds of cows in Gujarat, such as Gir and Kankrej, which hold spiritual, scientific, and health value. The main objective is to increase the breeding of these cows by encouraging Gaushalas and Panjrapole institutions that ideally keep cows. The scheme also aims to increase the consumption of Panchagavya products (derived from cow milk, urine, dung, ghee, and curd) of Gir and Kankrej cows and make rearing of cows economically viable, thereby ensuring their long-term sustenance and contribution to the rural economy.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Financial Assistance: Up to 75% of the total expenditure incurred on specific upgradation articles, with a maximum assistance of ₹4,00,000/- per Gaushala/Panjrapole.
Eligible Components for Assistance:
Water Fogger (for climate control in sheds)
Mechanized Reaper Machine or Reaper Machine (for fodder harvesting)
Chaff cutter (for fodder preparation)
Drip irrigation (for fodder cultivation)
500 liters bulk milk cooling machine with generator (for milk storage)
Mini Tractor or Big Tractor/Hydraulic Trailer or Trailer (for farm operations and transport)
Solar Gau Arc Machine/Gau Arc Machine (likely for cow-based product processing or energy needs)
Milking machine (for efficient milking)

Minimum Time Limit for Reclaiming Constituent Benefits: 1 Year (This implies that once assistance is received for a component, another application for the same component can be made only after one year).
Promotes the preservation and propagation of valuable indigenous cow breeds (Gir, Kankrej).
Enhances the infrastructure and facilities of Gaushalas and Panjrapoles.
Supports the economic viability of cow rearing through various improvements and value-added product promotion.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: Gaushalas and Panjrapole institutions registered under the Public Charity Act.
A Gaushala should have more than 50 cows of local origin. A Panjrapole must have more than 100 livestock (including cattle and other animals typically housed in a Panjrapole).

At least 3 (three) acres of land on which the institution has to purchase/develop the development work, must be in the institution's own name or on a lease of 99 years. There is no maximum land limit.
The institution must demonstrate a commitment to the preservation and promotion of indigenous cow breeds.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online and Offline Submission
list_items: Step 1: The applicant institution may visit and apply online at the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/.
Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then navigate to ‘Animal Husbandry Schemes’.
Step 3: Now, select the “Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole”. Click on the ‘Apply’ button, which will open the application page. The institution may need to register if not already done.
Step 4: Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application, filling in all required details about the institution and the proposed upgradation components.
Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections or modify details in a previously saved application.
Step 6: Once the application is completely filled and reviewed for accuracy, confirm it. Only confirmed applications will be processed.
Step 7: Take a printout of the confirmed online application.

Step 8: The printed application, along with the signature and stamp of the Nodal Officer of the concerned district and all necessary supporting documents listed in the application, must be submitted to the relevant board/department within 30 days of the online application.

Step 9: Applicants can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the 'Applicant Corner' section via the link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx.

sections.title: Documents Required
sections.content: The specific list of documents will be detailed in the online application form on the i-Khedut portal, but commonly required documents include:
list_items: Registration certificate of the Gaushala/Panjrapole under the Public Charity Act.
Proof of land ownership (7/12 extract) or 99-year registered lease deed for the required land area.
Proof of number of cows/livestock as per eligibility criteria (e.g., certificate from veterinary officer, livestock census data maintained by the institution).
Bank account details (copy of passbook/cancelled cheque) of the institution for direct benefit transfer.
Detailed proposal/project report for the proposed upgradation, including cost estimates for each component.
Photographs of the existing infrastructure.
Audited financial statements/annual reports of the institution (if required for assessment).
Pan Card of the institution/authorized signatory.
Aadhaar Card of the authorized signatory/head of the institution.
Any other documents as required by the scheme guidelines or the i-Khedut portal during the application process.

scheme_name: Pashupalan (GBCDC)
ministry: Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat (Implemented by Gujarat Backward Classes Development Corporation - GBCDC)

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Pashupalan (GBCDC)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, owned by both the Central and Gujarat Governments, aims to provide financial assistance for agriculture-related activities. Through this scheme, a low-interest loan amount is provided to support Pashu Palaks (Animal Rearers) in undertaking animal husbandry activities, specifically for purchasing cows and buffaloes. The scheme's core objective is to offer accessible financial aid at low-interest rates, supporting eligible individuals from Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) in Gujarat to establish or expand their animal husbandry ventures, thereby promoting self-employment and economic upliftment.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Low-Interest Loan: A loan is provided at a highly subsidized interest rate of 6% per annum, making it affordable for beneficiaries.
Maximum Loan Limit: The maximum loan limit under this scheme is up to ₹1,00,000/- per beneficiary, which can be utilized for various animal husbandry activities.
Unit Cost Coverage: The scheme covers 85% of the total unit cost of the animal husbandry project. The funding structure is as follows:
- 85% of this 85% will be provided by the national corporation (National Backward Classes Finance & Development Corporation - NBCFDC).
- 10% will be contributed by the state government (Gujarat Government).
- A minimum of 5% will be the beneficiary's own contribution, fostering ownership and responsibility.
Intended Use: The loan is specifically for agriculture-related activities, primarily animal husbandry, including the purchase of cows and buffaloes.
Repayment Terms: This loan is structured to be repaid in 60 equal monthly instalments (EMIs), inclusive of the interest, providing a manageable repayment schedule for the beneficiaries.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant must belong to a Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC) as notified by the Government.
The total annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹3,00,000/- (Rupees Three Lakhs only) from all sources.
The applicant's age should be between 21 and 45 years on the date of application.
The applicant must have relevant experience in the business requiring technical and other skills related to animal husbandry.
The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.
The loan is generally for new ventures or expansion of existing animal husbandry activities.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online
list_items: Step 1: Visit the Official Website: Go to the official website of the Gujarat Backward Classes Development Corporation (GBCDC) - https://sje.gujarat.gov.in/gbcdc/home.

Step 2: Locate and Apply for Scheme: Scroll down on the homepage or navigate to the 'Schemes' section. Find the "Pashupalan" scheme and click on "Apply Now" or the relevant application link. There might be a direct link for online application for schemes of the corporation.
Step 3: Access Application Form: You will be directed to the online application form.
Step 4: Scheme Selection & Loan Details: Select "Pashupalan" from the scheme options. Enter the Unit Cost of your proposed project and specify the Required Loan Amount.

Step 5: Applicant's Details: Provide comprehensive personal details including your Aadhaar number, Ration Card number, Voter ID number, full name (Last Name, First Name, Father's/Husband's Name), complete address (district, taluka, village, PIN code), date of birth, age (ensuring it falls between 21 and 45 years as of the specified date, e.g., 14/08/2023 as mentioned in the prompt, or the current application date), caste, subcaste, phone number, mobile number, email address, gender, and marital status.

Step 6: Income Details: Accurately enter your income certificate number, its issue date, the name of the issuing officer, and the total annual family income (which must be up to ₹3,00,000/-). Also, provide your parent/guardian's occupation.
Step 7: Disability Details (if applicable): If you are a "Physically Handicapped" applicant, select "Yes" and provide the percentage of your disability. Otherwise, select "No".

Step 8: Employment Details (if applicable): Indicate if any family member (including yourself) is currently employed in a government or private job. If "Yes," provide their Name, Designation, Place of work, and Salary details.

Step 9: Educational Qualification: Select your highest Educational Qualification from the provided options: Uneducated, Educated (likely indicating primary/secondary education), Graduation, Post Graduation, or Other Degree.

Step 10: Loan History: If you have taken a loan in the past from any corporation or government scheme, select "Yes" and provide details such as the loan date, amount sanctioned, amount repaid, remaining balance, and your previous loan account number. If not, select "No".

Step 11: Bank Account Details: Provide your bank account number, bank name, branch name, name as per account, account type (Saving/Current), MICR code, and IFSC code. Ensure these details are accurate for direct fund disbursement.
Step 12: Submission: Review all the information entered for accuracy and completeness. Once satisfied, click the "Submit" button to complete your application.

scheme_name: Assistance to General Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories
ministry: Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme “Assistance to General Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories" was launched by the Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, farmers from the General Category are provided with financial assistance in the form of a grant. The grant is a 65% subsidy towards the installation of suitable Submersible or Centrifugal motor pump sets with necessary accessories. This assistance is subject to a maximum limit of ₹50,000/- per tubewell per individual. The scheme aims to enhance irrigation facilities for general category farmers, thereby boosting agricultural productivity and supporting sustainable farming practices in Puducherry.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Financial Grant: A 65% subsidy on the installation cost of suitable Submersible or Centrifugal motor pump sets, including accessories.
Maximum Subsidy Amount: The subsidy is capped at ₹50,000/- per tubewell per individual.
Improved Irrigation: Enables farmers to access efficient water pumping solutions for irrigation, leading to better crop yields and agricultural productivity.
Reduced Financial Burden: Significantly lowers the upfront cost for farmers to install essential irrigation infrastructure.
Promotes Modern Farming: Encourages the adoption of modern and efficient irrigation technologies.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: The applicant should belong to the General Category.
The applicant should be a farmer residing in the Union Territory of Puducherry.
The tubewell in which the submersible/centrifugal motor pump sets are to be erected must have been registered with the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry.
The applicant should hold a minimum of 1.5 acres of land under the command area of the tubewell to be constructed.
The applicant must have ownership of the land for at least 2 years and should possess a clear ownership title deed in his/her name.
The eligible land holding of 1.5 acres can be in favor of the applicant farmer, their spouse, or a member of a joint/undivided family.
Farmers who have already availed themselves of the subsidy for the same purpose within the last 5 years are not entitled to any benefit under this scheme.

The applicant must not convert the agricultural lands for any purpose other than agriculture for a maximum period of 10 years from the date of construction of the tubewell/filter point and must execute a bond accordingly.

sections.title: Application Process
list_items: **Offline Application Process:**
Step 1: Obtain a mandatory PERMIT for the construction of a new/replacement tubewell from the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry. This permit is a prerequisite.

Step 2: Applicants from the Puducherry region should approach the concerned office for tubewell construction using departmental machinery. Those opting for construction through private machinery must first obtain a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the concerned office.

Step 3: After obtaining the NOC, the farmer can construct the tubewell using private machinery registered with the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority. An inspection will be conducted by the Agricultural Officer (Engg.) during construction to verify the details of pipes and materials used.

Step 4: After successful completion of the tubewell/filter point construction under departmental supervision, interested applicants should visit the concerned office during office hours to request a hard copy of the prescribed application form:
- For Puducherry: Office of the Hydrogeologist‐II, State Ground Water Unit & Soil Conservation, Thattanchavady, Puducherry‐9.
- For Karaikal: Office of the Additional Director of Agriculture, Karaikal.
Step 5: Fill in all mandatory fields in the application form, affix a passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach self-attested copies of all mandatory documents.
Step 6: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the aforementioned authority.

Step 7: Upon receipt, the application will be registered, a unique seniority number will be assigned, and an acknowledgment will be issued to the applicant. The application should be submitted within 90 days from the date of completion of the tubewell/filter point construction work.
**Online Application Process (e-District Portal):**
Step 1: Visit the Official Website of the e-District Portal of the Government of Puducherry (e.g., https://edistrict.py.gov.in/).
Step 2: At the top right corner of the homepage, click "Login." If you are a new user, click "Register a New Membership."

Step 3: On the Registration Page, fill in all mandatory fields: Username, Password, Confirm Password, Personal Details (Full Name, First Name, Email Address, Address, Current Address, Gender, Date of Birth, Mobile Number). Agree to the declaration, fill in the Captcha Code, and click "Signup."
Step 4: Once registered, revisit the Official Website of the e-District Portal.
Step 5: Click "Login," provide your Username and Password, fill in the Captcha Code, and click "Sign In."
Step 6: On the next screen, a list of schemes offered by the Government of Puducherry will be displayed Department-wise.
Step 7: Click on "Assistance to General Farmers for Installation of Submersible / Centrifugal Motor Pumpsets With Accessories" to access its online application form.

Step 8: In the application form, fill in all mandatory fields (marked with a red asterisk) and upload all mandatory documents (self-attest if required). Ensure scanned copies are clear and adhere to specified formats/sizes.

Step 9: Tick the declaration stating "I hereby declare that the above-mentioned details are true and correct as per the best of my Knowledge." Submit the application and note the application number for tracking. The application number will also be sent to your Registered Mobile Number / Registered Email ID.
**Application Status Tracking:**
Applicants can check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the 'Applicant Corner' or similar section on the e-District portal after logging in.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Certificate for the ownership of the land, issued by an officer not below the rank of Deputy Tahsildar.
Copy of the Registration certificate, Permit, and Energisation Certificate issued by the Pondicherry Ground Water Authority, Puducherry (mandatory for the tubewell).

Original bills for the expenses incurred towards the construction of the tubewell. In case of a bank loan, an attested copy of the original bills and a certificate from the Bank to that effect are required.
Copy of the Aadhaar card of the applicant.
Farmer's Identity Card (if available; otherwise, relevant documents to prove farmer status).
Bank passbook front page copy (for direct benefit transfer).

Affidavit: Upon selection, beneficiaries must submit an affidavit signed before a Notary Public. This affidavit must state that the land is under their possession, they will not sell, mortgage, or transfer the lands for 10 years, and they will not convert the land for any purpose other than agriculture. It also states that in case of non-compliance, they will be liable for legal action, recovery, or cancellation of subsidy.
Passport-sized photograph of the applicant.
Proof of residence in Puducherry (e.g., Domicile Certificate, if not covered by Aadhaar).
Copy of Joint/Undivided Family Deed (if land ownership is in the name of spouse or a family member).
Any other document specifically requested by the Department of Agriculture and Farmer's Welfare or the e-District portal.

scheme_name: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas: Water Augmentation
ministry: Coffee Board, Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce and Industry

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas: Water Augmentation" is a sub-component of the broader "Integrated Coffee Development Project During the Medium Term Framework (MTF) Period: Development Support to Stakeholders," launched by the Coffee Board, Department of Commerce, Ministry of Commerce and Industry. The core objective of this scheme is to enhance the production and productivity of coffee plantations by promoting and supporting water augmentation measures in traditional coffee-growing regions. This includes the establishment of water harvesting structures and the adoption of efficient irrigation equipment to ensure water availability for coffee cultivation.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Scale of Subsidy for General Beneficiaries:** 40% of the unit cost, with a maximum ceiling of ₹2,50,000 per beneficiary for all combined components under the water augmentation scheme.

**Additional Support for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe (SC/ST) Community:** Coffee growers belonging to the SC/ST community with a coffee holding size of up to 4.00 hectares are eligible for an *additional* 10% of the unit cost (total 50%), with the same ceiling of ₹2,50,000 per beneficiary for all components put together under the water augmentation scheme.

**Mode of Payment:** The Deputy Director (Extn.), upon confirming the admissibility of the claim, will sanction the eligible subsidy amount and release it directly to the bank account of the applicant through Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT), Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS), or National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT), ensuring a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mechanism.

However, the quantum of subsidy shall be applicable based on the unit cost for each holding category indicated in the tables above or based on the actual cost, whichever is less.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Applicant Type:** This subsidy is available to individual coffee growers, joint owners, or family members applying jointly (limited to mother, father, wife, and children).
**Holding Size:** Eligible applicants can possess coffee holdings of up to 10 hectares.
**Subsidy Applicability:** The subsidy is applicable for two primary purposes:
(a) Water harvesting structures like water storage tanks, open wells, or ring wells.
(b) Procurement of irrigation equipment, including sprinkler or drip systems.

**Subsidy Conditions (Prevention of Duplication):** A grower who has availed subsidy for a specific activity/component cannot avail it again during the Multi-Year Thrust Plan (MTF) period unless new beneficiaries are included. This ensures equitable distribution of benefits.

**Subsidy Combination:** The subsidy may be availed for any one of the water harvesting structures combined with any one of the irrigation equipment during the MTF period. The subsidy amount is limited to the corresponding category of holdings.

**Previous Subsidy History:** Growers who have benefited from a subsidy for a particular water augmentation activity within the past 10 years are not eligible for the same activity. However, they become eligible from the 11th year onwards, promoting regular updates and new investments.

**Infrastructure Location:** Water augmentation infrastructure should be created either within the coffee estate or in its vicinity, depending on the water source. The land for this purpose should be in the name of the grower or their family members (mother, father, wife, and children only).
**Non-Traditional Areas Eligibility:** Non-tribal coffee growers in Non-Traditional Areas with coffee holdings of up to 10 hectares are also eligible for this subsidy, extending the scheme's reach.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Online (for Feasibility Report and Claim Submission)
list_items: **For Obtaining Technical Feasibility Report (TFR):**
Step 1: Visit the Official Website/Portal of the Coffee Board (www.coffeeboard.gov.in).
Step 2: In the top ribbon, click on "Online Services," then click "Subsidy." You will be redirected to the Online Application Form.

Step 3: Fill in all the mandatory fields of the Application Form and upload all the required documents in the specified format and size. This typically includes application forms, proof of identity (Aadhaar), proof of land ownership, a rough sketch of the estate, quotations for equipment, and caste certificates for SC/ST growers.

Step 4: Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections. Acknowledge and agree to the terms and conditions, declaration, and privacy policy. Click the "Submit" or "Apply" button to send your application. You will receive a confirmation message.
Step 5: Review and Inspection: The jurisdictional Coffee Board office will scrutinize your submitted documents and conduct a field inspection as part of the verification process.
Step 6: Technical Feasibility Report (TFR) Issuance: Once the inspection is complete and the documents are verified, the office will issue a Technical Feasibility Report (TFR) to you.

**Important Note:** It is crucial to obtain the TFR *before* commencing any activities related to the scheme (e.g., constructing water tanks, purchasing irrigation equipment). Activities started before obtaining the TFR are not eligible for claiming the subsidy.
**For Claiming Subsidy (after obtaining TFR and completing activity):**

Step 1: Claim Submission: The applicant/s should submit the subsidy claim in the prescribed formats (in duplicate) along with the necessary documents (e.g., original invoices, work completion report) to the jurisdictional Coffee Board office.
Step 2: Document Scrutiny: The concerned office will meticulously scrutinize all documents provided by the applicant to ensure compliance with scheme guidelines.
Step 3: Field Inspection: The office will carry out a physical field inspection to validate the claims made regarding the completed water augmentation activity.
Step 4: Physical Verification Report: A Physical Verification Report is prepared, confirming the admissibility of the claim in all respects based on the inspection and document verification.
Step 5: Forwarding to Deputy Director (Extn): The office forwards the claim statement and relevant records to the concerned Deputy Director (Extension) for final approval.
Step 6: Claim Scrutiny by Deputy Director (Extn): The Deputy Director (Extn) examines the claim and records to confirm the admissibility of the claim in all respects.
Step 7: Subsidy Release: Once the claim is found eligible and approved, the Deputy Director (Extn) releases the subsidy amount directly to the bank account of the applicant via EFT/RTGS/NEFT.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: **For Obtaining Feasibility Report (TFR):**
1. Application and Self Declaration: Duly filled and signed by the applicant/s (in duplicate) in the prescribed format available on the portal.
2. Aadhaar Card (UIDAI): Proof of identity and address.
3. Proof of Land Ownership: In one of the following forms (as applicable to the state):
a) Copy of Patta (Record of Rights) / Khatha Extract along with Record of Rights (RTC) for all survey numbers having coffee in possession of the applicant in Karnataka.
b) Copy of Land Possession Certificate issued by the Competent Revenue Authority along with RTCs for all survey numbers having multiple names in the RTCs in Kodagu District, Karnataka.
c) Copy of Chitta & Adangal or Land Possession Certificate with Adangal in Tamil Nadu.
d) Copy of the Land Possession Certificate issued by the competent Revenue Authority of Kerala.

e) In the case of joint ownership properties, if an individual application is submitted, the applicant should produce revenue records from the revenue authority indicating the extent of Coffee holding exclusively in his name.

4. Self-prepared rough Sketch of the Estate: Along with Check Bandi / Boundaries marked with clear demarcation of the site where the activity is proposed to be taken up, duly signed by the applicant/s.
5. Quotation: In respect of purchase of machinery/equipment (if applicable, for irrigation equipment).
6. Self-Prepared Plan and Estimation: For Water Storage Tank / Open Well / Ring Well (if civil works are proposed).
7. General Power of Attorney (GPA): If the applicant is a GPA holder, an attested copy of the Registered GPA.
8. Caste Certificate: In the case of Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe (SC/ST) category growers, a caste certificate issued by the competent authority.
9. Copy of the Bank Pass Book: Having the details of account number, name of the Bank, Branch, Indian Financial System Code (IFSC) Code, etc., preferably Aadhaar Seeded.
**For Claiming Subsidy (after activity completion):**
1. Claim Statements: In the prescribed format (in duplicate) as provided by the Coffee Board.
2. Invoice / Bill (original): With Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) or GSTIN, towards the purchase of irrigation equipment or materials for civil works.
3. Self-prepared work completion report and fund utilization certificate signed by the applicant.
4. Photographs of the completed work (before and after, if required).
5. Any other document specified by the Coffee Board during the TFR issuance or claim process.

scheme_name: Conversion/Modernisation of Mechanised Fishing Boats for Deep Sea Fishing
ministry: Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Conversion/Modernisation of Mechanised Fishing Boats for Deep Sea Fishing" is a sub-component under the umbrella scheme "Financial Assistance for Availing Subsidy Components for the Development of Marine Fisheries" by the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Government of Puducherry. This scheme is designed with the primary objective of increasing marine fish production by providing financial grants for the conversion and modernization of existing mechanized boats to enable them for deep-sea fishing operations. This initiative aims to enhance the capacity and efficiency of the fishing fleet, improve the livelihood of fishermen, and promote sustainable deep-sea fishing practices in the Union Territory.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: Financial Grant: A 50% subsidy on the cost of conversion/modernization of mechanized fishing boats for deep-sea fishing.
Maximum Subsidy Limit: The subsidy is subject to a maximum of ₹2,50,000 per boat.
Bank Finance Linkage: The subsidy is linked to bank finance, meaning it's provided in conjunction with a loan from a bank.
Increased Fish Production: Supports activities that can lead to higher marine fish catches by facilitating access to deep-sea resources.
Modernization of Fleet: Encourages the upgrade of fishing vessels with essential equipment for deep-sea operations.
Economic Upliftment: Aims to improve the economic condition of fishermen by enabling them to engage in more lucrative deep-sea fishing.
Flexibility: The rate of subsidy and the maximum limit may be revised by the Government from time to time, allowing for adaptation to changing economic conditions and industry needs.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: Applicant Category: The applicant should either belong to the fishermen community or be professionally engaged in fishing/fish trade occupation on a full-time basis, or be a prospective entrepreneur in the fisheries sector.
Residency: The applicant must have resided in the Union Territory of Puducherry for a continuous period of not less than five years at the time of applying for subsidies/grants.
Co-operative Membership: The applicant must have been enrolled as a member of a Fishermen Co-operative Society.
Age Limit: The applicant's age must be above 23 years and below 60 years at the time of application.
Other Benefits: The applicant must not have been a recipient of an Old Age Pension issued by any department.
Employment Status: The applicant should not be employed in Government/Government Undertakings/Fishermen Co-operative Society.

Financial Standing: The applicant must not have any outstanding dues to be paid to the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare or any Fishermen Co-operative Societies at the time of making the application.
Boat Registration: The mechanized boat intended for conversion/modernization must be registered.

Boat Specifications: The hull of the boat should be extended to above 47 feet of overall length. The boat must be procured and fixed with new essential deep-sea fishing accessories such as a hydraulic winch, steel ropes, a global positioning system (GPS), an echo sounder, an inbuilt insulated ice-box, and life-saving appliances.
Provisional Loan Sanction: The applicant must have obtained a provisional loan sanction order from a bank for the modernization/conversion project.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the Office/Sub-Office of the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare in Puducherry.
Step 2: The applicant should request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority at the office.

Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields accurately. Paste a recent passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required). Attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as listed in the scheme guidelines.
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with all the supporting documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare office.

Step 5: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable), for future reference and tracking of the application.

list_items: Passport Sized Photograph (recent).
Aadhaar Card (for identity and address proof).

scheme_name: Floriculture Development Scheme
ministry: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The “Floriculture Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The primary objective of this scheme is to encourage and motivate farmers across the state to adopt floriculture (both traditional and non-traditional flowers) as a viable commercial venture. This is achieved by providing crucial support through the distribution of high-quality planting materials and other essential inputs. The scheme aims to boost the economic income of farmers by promoting low-volume, high-value floricultural crops, thereby contributing to the agricultural diversification and economic upliftment in Meghalaya.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Pattern of Assistance:**
- Provision of good quality flower planting material at a 50% subsidy.

- Provision of low-cost polyhouse free of cost, with a minimum unit area of 100 sqm/unit. (Note: While the provided text states 'free of cost', other sources sometimes mention 100% assistance for polyhouses of certain sizes, confirming the cost is fully covered by the scheme for the specified minimum unit area).
**Type of Assistance (Inputs and Infrastructure):**
- Motivation for farmers to cultivate low volume, high-value crops to significantly increase their economic income.
- Provision of poly houses (protected cultivation infrastructure).
- Supply of good quality flower planting materials.
- Provision of essential inputs including organic fertilizers, micronutrients, organic-based and Plant Protection (P.P.) chemicals.
- Support for installing drip irrigation systems, promoting efficient water use in floriculture.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Residency:** The applicant/farmer should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
**Farmer Status:** The applicant must be a bonafide farmer genuinely engaged in agriculture.

**Land Holding (for selection):** Bonafide farmers having a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (2000 square meters) and willing to invest for future expansion in terms of planting materials, infrastructures, etc., are prioritized for selection. (This appears to be a selection criterion rather than a strict eligibility cutoff for application, implying a willingness to expand is key).

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 01: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply by writing an application on a plain paper, expressing their interest in the Floriculture Development Scheme and stating their proposed floriculture activities.
Step 02: Along with the application, attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as required by the scheme.

Step 03: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with all the supporting documents at your nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block (Community Development Block) or a Horticulture Circle.

**Mode of Selection of Beneficiary(s):** Beneficiaries are selected from bonafide farmers who have a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (2000 square meters) and demonstrate willingness to invest for future expansion in terms of planting materials, infrastructure, etc.
**Whom to Contact for Assistance/Information:**
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Passport-size photograph of the applicant.
Identity Proof (e.g., Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card, or any other government-issued ID).
Bank passbook/account details (for potential direct benefit transfer of subsidies).
Documents proof of possessing agricultural land (e.g., land patta, land ownership certificate, or relevant revenue records).

Any other document as required by the Horticulture Development Officer or District Horticulture Officer during the application or verification process (e.g., self-declaration of bonafide farmer status, rough sketch of the farm, etc.).

scheme_name: Plantation Crop Development Scheme
ministry: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme “Plantation Crop Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. Its primary objective is to significantly boost the area under cultivation and overall production of various key plantation crops in the state, including Arecanut, Cashewnut, Coconut, and Pineapple. To achieve this, the scheme provides crucial financial assistance to farmers by offering a 50% subsidy on planting materials and polypipes, as well as for the construction of soakage tanks, which are vital for water management in plantations. This initiative aims to strengthen the plantation sector and enhance the economic well-being of farmers in Meghalaya.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Type of Assistance:**
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the purchase of high-quality planting materials for various plantation crops.
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the purchase of polypipes, essential for irrigation and water management.
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the construction of soakage tanks, crucial for water conservation and availability for plantation crops.
**Pattern of Assistance:** The assistance provided under this scheme is typically for one year, focusing on initial support for establishing or enhancing plantation crops.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Residency:** The applicant/farmer should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.

**Farmer Status & Land Holding:** The applicant must be a bonafide farmer genuinely engaged in Agriculture, possessing either their own land or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares (approximately 0.5 acres) or more.
**Scheme Availability:** The applicant farmer can avail of the benefits of the scheme on a first-come, first-served basis, subject to meeting all other eligibility criteria.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 01: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply by writing a formal application on plain paper, expressing their interest in the Plantation Crop Development Scheme and outlining their proposed plantation activities.
Step 02: Along with the application, attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as required by the scheme guidelines.

Step 03: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with all the supporting documents at your nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD (Community Development) Block or a Horticulture Circle.
**Mode of Selection of Beneficiary(s):** Beneficiaries are selected from eligible bonafide farmers on a first-come, first-served basis, ensuring fairness in distribution of benefits.
**Whom to Contact for Assistance/Information:**
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Passport-size photograph of the applicant.
Identity Proof (e.g., Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card, PAN Card, or Driving License).
Bank passbook/account details (front page showing account number, bank name, branch, IFSC code for subsidy disbursement).
Documents proof of possessing own or leased agricultural land (e.g., land patta, land ownership certificate, land tax receipt, or a copy of the lease agreement if applicable).

Any other document as required by the Horticulture Development Officer or District Horticulture Officer (e.g., self-declaration of bonafide farmer status, a rough sketch of the farm where plantations will be undertaken, etc.).

scheme_name: Financial Assistance for Setting up Crab Culture Unit
ministry: Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Setting up Crab Culture Unit” is an initiative by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. This scheme provides financial assistance to eligible individuals, fish farmers, registered Self Help Groups (SHGs), and societies who are interested in establishing a crab culture unit within the State of Goa. The assistance covers 25% of the actual cost for setting up the unit, with a ceiling of ₹1,50,000 per hectare. Applications for this scheme are accepted exclusively in offline mode. The objective is to promote crab farming as a sustainable aquaculture practice, contributing to the economic upliftment of those involved in the fisheries sector in Goa.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **For Setting Up of the Crab Culture Unit:**
- Financial assistance of 25% of the actual cost of setting up the unit, limited to a maximum of ₹1,50,000 per hectare.
- This assistance can be availed for up to 2 hectares of land.
**For Purchase of Seed and Feed:**
- Financial assistance of 50% of the actual cost for the purchase of crab seed and feed, limited to a maximum of ₹75,000 per hectare.
- This assistance can also be availed for up to 2 hectares of land.
The scheme aims to reduce the initial investment and operational costs for farmers, making crab culture a more accessible and profitable venture.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Applicant Type:** The applicant should be a Fish Farmer, an Individual, a Registered Self Help Group, or a Society, with a genuine interest in setting up a Crab Farming Unit in the State of Goa.
**Residency:** The applicant must have been a resident of Goa for a continuous period of not less than fifteen years at the time of application.

**Training Requirement:** The applicant must have successfully undergone a training program on Crab Farming. This training should be organized by recognized institutions such as the Fisheries Department (Goa), Marine Products Export Development Authority (MPEDA), Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), or other approved institutes specializing in aquaculture.
**Land Availability:** The applicant should have suitable land for setting up the unit (implied by the requirement of land documents and survey plan).

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 1: The interested applicant should obtain a printout of the prescribed format of the application form. These forms are typically available at the Department of Fisheries offices or on their official website.

Step 2: Carefully fill in all the mandatory fields in the application form. Paste a passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required). Attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as specified in the scheme guidelines.

Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with all the supporting documents to the concerned authority at the Department of Fisheries, Dayanand Bandodkar Marg, Patto Colony, Panaji Goa - 403 521. Alternatively, the application can be submitted to the official posted at the nearest Block Development Officer (BDO) Office/Sub-Offices of the Department of Fisheries.

Step 4: It is strongly recommended to request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority upon submission. This receipt should include essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable), for future reference and tracking of the application status.

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Application in Prescribed Form (duly filled).

Survey Plan Showing Neighboring Area in Original (detailed map of the proposed farm site and its surroundings).

Residence Certificate of 15 Years in Goa (issued by the competent authority, e.g., Mamlatdar, confirming long-term residency).
Training Completion Certificate of Crab Farming from Directorate of Fisheries/MPEDA/ICAR/Any Other Institute (proof of mandatory training).

sections.content: Any dissatisfaction or complaint regarding any service or its standards related to this scheme can be registered with the Department's Grievance Redressal Officer. scheme_name: Floriculture Development Scheme
ministry: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The “Floriculture Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. The primary objective of this scheme is to encourage and motivate farmers across the state to adopt floriculture (both traditional and non-traditional flowers) as a viable commercial venture. This is achieved by providing crucial support through the distribution of high-quality planting materials and other essential inputs. The scheme aims to boost the economic income of farmers by promoting low-volume, high-value floricultural crops, thereby contributing to the agricultural diversification and economic upliftment in Meghalaya.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Pattern of Assistance:**
- Provision of good quality flower planting material at a 50% subsidy.

- Provision of low-cost polyhouse free of cost, with a minimum unit area of 100sqm/unit. This aims to cover the full cost for polyhouses of the specified minimum unit size, promoting protected cultivation.
**Type of Assistance (Inputs and Infrastructure):**
- Motivation for farmers to cultivate low volume, high-value crops to significantly increase their economic income.
- Provision of poly houses (protected cultivation infrastructure).
- Supply of good quality flower planting materials (e.g., seeds, seedlings, plantlets, bulbs, corms, tubers).
- Provision of essential inputs including organic fertilizers, micronutrients, organic-based and Plant Protection (P.P.) chemicals.
- Support for installing drip irrigation systems, promoting efficient water use in floriculture.
- Incentives to buy tools and appliances such as scissors, pruning knives, watering pots/cans, digging spades, fork, measuring tools, hanging baskets, lawnmowers, etc.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Residency:** The applicant/farmer should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
**Farmer Status:** The applicant should be a bonafide farmer genuinely engaged in agriculture.

**Land Holding (for selection):** Bonafide farmers having a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (2000 square meters) and willing to invest for future expansion in terms of planting materials, infrastructures, etc., are prioritized for selection.
**Familiarity:** Beneficiary must have some level of familiarity with ornamental crops.
**Financial Support:** Beneficiary must have the necessary financial support (though subsidy helps, implies some personal investment capacity or willingness to secure loans for expansion).

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 01: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply by writing a formal application on plain paper, expressing their interest in the Floriculture Development Scheme and stating their proposed floriculture activities.
Step 02: Along with the application, attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as required by the scheme.

Step 03: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with all the supporting documents at your nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block (Community Development Block) or a Horticulture Circle.

**Mode of Selection of Beneficiary(s):** Beneficiaries are selected from bonafide farmers who have a minimum area of 0.2 hectares (2000 square meters) and demonstrate willingness to invest for future expansion in terms of planting materials, infrastructure, etc. Selection may also be on a 'first come first served' basis or through specific beneficiary selection procedures by the respective District Horticulture Officer.
**Whom to Contact for Assistance/Information:**
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

ministry: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The “Plantation Crop Development Scheme” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya. Its primary objective is to significantly boost the area under cultivation and overall production of various key plantation crops in the state, including Arecanut, Cashewnut, Coconut, and Pineapple. To achieve this, the scheme provides crucial financial assistance to farmers by offering a 50% subsidy on planting materials and polypipes, as well as for the construction of soakage tanks, which are vital for water management in plantations. This initiative aims to strengthen the plantation sector and enhance the economic well-being of farmers in Meghalaya.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Type of Assistance:**
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the purchase of high-quality planting materials for various plantation crops.
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the purchase of polypipes, essential for irrigation and water management.
- Financial assistance at a 50% subsidy for the construction of soakage tanks, crucial for water conservation and availability for plantation crops.
**Pattern of Assistance:** The assistance provided under this scheme is for one year, focusing on initial support for establishing or enhancing plantation crops.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Residency:** The applicant/farmer should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.

**Farmer Status & Land Holding:** The applicant must be a bonafide farmer genuinely engaged in Agriculture, possessing either their own land or leased land of at least 0.2 hectares (approximately 0.5 acres) or more.
**Scheme Availability:** The applicant farmer can avail of the benefits of the scheme on a first-come, first-served basis, subject to meeting all other eligibility criteria.

sections.title: Application Process
sections.content: Offline
list_items: Step 01: The eligible bonafide farmer can apply by writing a formal application on plain paper, expressing their interest in the Plantation Crop Development Scheme and outlining their proposed plantation activities.
Step 02: Along with the application, attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as required by the scheme guidelines.

Step 03: Submit the duly filled and signed application along with all the supporting documents at your nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD (Community Development) Block or a Horticulture Circle.
**Mode of Selection of Beneficiary(s):** Beneficiaries are selected from eligible bonafide farmers on a first-come, first-served basis, ensuring fairness in distribution of benefits.
**Whom to Contact for Assistance/Information:**
1. District Horticulture Officer
2. Horticulture Development Officer

sections.title: Documents Required
list_items: Passport-size photograph of the applicant.
Identity Proof (e.g., Aadhaar Card, Voter ID Card, PAN Card, or Driving License).
Bank passbook/account details (front page showing account number, bank name, branch, and IFSC code for subsidy disbursement).
Documents proof of possessing own or leased agricultural land (e.g., land passbook, land tax receipt, land ownership certificate, or a copy of the valid lease agreement if applicable).

Any other document as required by the Horticulture Development Officer or District Horticulture Officer during the application or verification process (e.g., self-declaration of bonafide farmer status, a rough sketch of the farm where plantations will be undertaken, income certificate if specific income criteria apply, etc.).
