sections.title: Details
sections.content: The "Masala Shetra Vistar Yojana" was launched by the Government of Madhya Pradesh under the Horticulture and Food Processing Department. The primary objective of this scheme is to expand the cultivation area and significantly increase the production of selected spice crops by promoting the use of quality high-yielding varieties. This initiative aims to bolster the spice farming sector in the state, ensuring better income for farmers and enhancing agricultural diversity.

sections.title: Selected Crops
list_items: Seed spice crops (e.g., Coriander, Cumin, Fennel, Fenugreek).
Turmeric (specifically with rhizomes, indicating focus on planting material).
Ginger.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **For Seed Spice Crops:** A subsidy of 50% of the cost of seed, with a maximum limit of ₹10,000/- per hectare, whichever amount is less.
**For Root and Rhizome Commercial Crops (Garlic, Turmeric, Ginger):** A grant of 50% of the cost of planting material, with a maximum limit of ₹50,000/- per hectare, whichever amount is less.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Current Cultivation Status:** The scheme targets farmers who are not currently cultivating spices, encouraging new entrants into spice farming.

**Applicability:** This scheme is applicable to farmers from all sections of society, indicating a broad reach without caste or economic status restrictions (except for the income criteria typically linked to state schemes, which is not specified here).
**Forest Rights Certificate Holders:** Farmers who have obtained a forest rights certificate are also eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme, recognizing their land rights.
**Grant Frequency:** The grant will be payable only once to a farmer, ensuring that benefits are spread across different beneficiaries.

**Land Area for Grant:** A farmer can undertake farming in any area size for the first time, but the grant will be payable for a minimum of 0.25 hectares and a maximum of 2.00 hectares. This sets the range for which financial assistance is provided.

sections.title: Details
sections.content: The scheme "Grant of 50% Subsidy for the Purchase of Aquarium and Its Accessories" is a sub-component under the broader scheme "Development of Freshwater Aquaculture and Setting up of Aquarium, Ornamental Fish Breeding Centre". This scheme is available across all regions of the Union Territory of Puducherry. It has been introduced with the objective of propagating the importance of aquarium keeping and inculcating the art of aquarium keeping among the general public, thereby promoting ornamental fish culture as a hobby and potential livelihood.

sections.title: Benefits
list_items: **Assessed Unit Cost:** The department has assessed the maximum unit cost for an aquarium and its accessories at ₹7,000.
**Contents of the Unit:** The aquarium unit provided to beneficiaries typically consists of:
- One aquarium/moulded aquarium (specific size may be required by applicant).
- One stand for the aquarium.
- One power filter for water purification.
- One air pump for aeration.
- Two 1-foot tube lights for illumination.
- 10 kgs of gravel for substrate.
- 9 numbers of goldfish (starter fish).
- One 100 grams fish food pocket.
- One scoop net.
**Pattern of Assistance (in ₹):**
- **Unit cost:** ₹7,000 (Maximum)*
- **50% subsidy by Government:** ₹3,500 (Maximum)*

- **50% and above the cost of an aquarium to be paid by the beneficiary:** ₹3,500 (Maximum)* (to be paid to the Secretary/Administrator of PSFCF/KFCMU/Fishermen Co-operative Societies in Mahe and Yanam).
*Note: The unit cost, subsidy rate, and maximum limits may vary from time to time as revised by the Government.

sections.title: Eligibility
list_items: **Residency:** The applicant should be a resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry by domicile or by birth, providing proof of residency.
**Age:** The applicant should have attained 18 years of age at the time of application.
**Previous Beneficiary Status:** The applicant or any member of their family should not have previously benefited under this specific scheme. This ensures wider distribution of benefits.
**Housing/Commercial Space:** The applicant should possess a pucca house (permanent structure) or a commercial place that is suitable and safe for keeping an aquarium.
**Application Specifics:** Applicants should specify the size of the aquarium they want to purchase, as shown in the application form, for subsidized rate consideration.

sections.title: Application Process

list_items: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit the office of the concerned authority in their respective region: Pondicherry State Fishermen Co-operative Federation Limited (PSFCF), Puducherry / The Karaikal Fishermen Co-operative Marketing Union (KFCMU), Karaikal / The Assistant Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Mahe / The Assistant Director of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare, Yanam.
Step 2: Request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority at the visited office.

Step 3: Accurately fill in all the mandatory fields in the application form. Paste a passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required). Attach self-attested copies of all the mandatory documents as specified in the scheme guidelines.
Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with all the supporting documents to the concerned authority.

Step 5: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority upon submission. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable), for future reference and tracking of the application. Field Officers recommend applications based on the location of the applicant's house or residential place to the Selection Committee.
